definition: to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: The third one's roots lacerate my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 第三支百合的根撐破我的嘴。

sentences.english: Well they broke my frame. Washington D. C.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，美國，他已經將我的框框撐破。

sentences.english: Don't stuff anything else in, or the bag will burst.
sentences.chinese: 不能再塞任何東西了，否則包會撐破的。

sentences.english: If you are not careful, you are going to burst the balloon .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不小心的話，會把氣球撐破的。
今天撐破肚，明天勒緊褲。

sentences.english: It can broken a hard glass bottle.
sentences.chinese: 它能將一隻堅固的玻璃杯撐破。

to form a scar/to form a scab
lit. to shoot from both sides (idiom)/fig. to display ambidexterity/to slap with one hand and then the other, in quick succession/to use both feet equally (football)
to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
